FuncDef:
The ip address dhcp-alloc command enables the DHCP client function on an interface.
The undo ip address dhcp-alloc command disables the DHCP client function on an interface. The ip address dhcp-alloc command enables the DHCP client function on an interface. The undo ip address dhcp-alloc command disables the DHCP client function on an interface. By default, the DHCP client function is disabled on an interface.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that the client requests the server to unicast response packets to the client.
-

ExtraInfo: To enable an interface of the device to obtain IP addresses using DHCP, enable the DHCP client function on the interface. A BOOTP client applies for an IP address from the server using DHCP. The DHCP client has two functions:- Sends DHCP Request messages to the server.- Processes DHCP Reply messages from the server.To obtain an IP address, the DHCP client sends a DHCP Request message to the server. After the server receives the DHCP Request message, it sends a DHCP response message to the DHCP client. The DHCP client obtains the assigned IP address from the response message.
